text: Wakaleo schouteni is an extinct marsupial that once lived in Asia. It is closely related to the marsupial lion, Thylacoleo carnifex, which lived until 30,000 years ago.Extinct kangaroo-like lion discovered in Australia: Extinct kangaroo-like lion discovered in Australia, accessdate: December 7, 2017 Wakaleo schouteni is estimated to have become extinct about 19 million years ago.. It was the size of a small dog, and would have weighed about 23 kg. Scientists have estimated it is one of the oldest known members of the marsupial lion family. The small marsupial lion has been named after wildlife artist, Peter Schouten.Manning River Times: Ancient species named after wildlife illustrator | Manning River Times, accessdate: December 7, 2017 He has worked with paleontologists from the University of New South Wales, studying the fossils at the Riversleigh site in Queensland. They found the fossilized skull, teeth and humerus bone of the marsupial lion.The People Post: Remains of ancient extinct lion species discovered in Australia | The People Post , accessdate: December 7, 2017 At the time it lived the area would have been rainforest and it would have eaten small birds, possums and lizards. ==References== Category:Marsupials of Australia Category:Extinct mammals
